page.title: 04Churches in our area.
page.content: There are three churches in our area. The Chapel at Seagry is the oldest Methodist Chapel in this county. It was built by two brothers, John and Peter Carey. They gave the land for the Chapel. They built it not as it is today. It had small windows. One hundred and ten years ago they wanted a new roof so they built the walls up higher and put the roof on. John and Peter Carey lived in the house which joins on to the Chapel. Another Chapel exists in Startley but this is in a poor state of repair. The Church of St.Mary the Virgin at Lower Seagry was completely rebuilt in 1849,having originally been founded in 1172 by Walter de Clifford.Many relics of the old Church were replaced in the new building,which is full of historic interest.
